data.title: Overture presentation on Central Office (Exchange): Home to the New Telco Cloud - 2014
data.meta_description: Overture presentation on Central Office (Exchange): Home to the New Telco Cloud - 2014 - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress1 OVERTURENETWORKS.COM Central Office (Exchange): Home to the New Telco Cloud D. Mark Durrett, Head of Marketing October 16, 2013

2. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress2 Pressure on Business Telecoms Operators OTT Service providers are changing the game New providers beating them at their own game

3. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress3 Operators Responding with their Own Cloud “There were 300 cloud service launches by telcos in 2012” - Camille Mendler, Informa Source: Informa 2013

4. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress4 “Only 11 percent of SMBs said their preference was for buying cloud services from the same company that currently provides voice and Internet” – Metaswitch 2013 Study “Current Telco Cloud strategies, while defendable starting points, are generally insufficient to create sufficiently attractive, large enough or fast enough traction.” – Arthur D Little 2013 Challenge: Businesses don’t look to Telcos for Cloud Services “Service providers such as telcos lag the smaller, pure cloud players in driving cloud propositions” - Rolf Meakin, PwC

5. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress5 Opportunity: Bring Cloud to the Metro Edge Leveraging cloud technologies to … • Provide agility and scalability • Simplify back office integration • Create application-aware network • Create network-aware applications • Provide flexible workload placement • Reduce OPEX and CAPEX • Offer fast path to new features and services Existing Cloud Technology is Ready for NFV Only a Few Missing Pieces must be assembled

6. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress6 Open Industry Initiative • Open partnership begun by CIMI Corp and 6 companies • Inviting others to participate • Based on ETSI NFV initiative launched by major service providers in October 2012 • Platform and architecture to demonstrate NFV and SDN using cloud virtualization concepts • Using real-world technology, tackling real-world applications and services • Demonstrates the full scope of end-end services Overture is founding member of CloudNFV

7. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress7 But Wait – Can’t the OTT and Cloud Guys do this Too? Yes, but ….

8. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress8 Source: Infonetics 2013 Survey Top 5 NFV Use Cases Latency, Scale, Security drives NFV to the Edge Nearly all the profitable Internet traffic transits less than 40 miles, meaning it never leaves the metro area – Tom Nolle, CIMI Corp.

9. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress9 Central Office #2 Central Office #1 Buy Local - NFV Cloud in Central Office Regional Cloud Data center Virtual Functions (VNFs) live here Latency sensitive, Security sensitive, High performance VNFs Network Service Consumers Network Service Consumers Telco CO-based Cloud Data Center (fog) Image Courtesy of

10. ©2013 Overture Networks SDN and OpenFlow World Congress10 Summary • Cloud is both opportunity and threat for Telecoms • OTT Providers already causing Headaches • NFV offers opportunity to differentiate from the CO • NFV requires Carrier-class Management & Orchestration
